frameDefinitions: These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.
A Device or machine is put in (or out of) service either by a volitional Agent or by a Cause event or force acting on the Device.
These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
A Cognizer faces a choice on some Issue.
Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar Production.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
frameExamples: Robin <t>sold</t> a car to Abby for $5,000.
The laborer realized that he <t>activated</t> the machine but did not know how to stop it.
I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
Dave Hayes <t>wavered</t> about moving to California because so many of his friends are in Baltimore.
Steven Spielberg <t>directed</t> several films for Universal Pictures.
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who changes the operational state of the <fen>Device</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the <fen>Device</fen> to begin to operate.
The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who repeatedly changes their mind about which of the <fen>Options</fen> to choose.
The <fen>Options</fen> are the alternative courses of action or the alternative physical or concrete entities that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> can choose from.
The <fen>Issue</fen> is a question about a course of action or a choice between items.

When there is an explicitly separate construal of the <fen>Options</fen>, <fen>Option_1</fen> is the first-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a from-PP. When it is clear that  the <fen>Cognizer</fen> actually acted on their choice, <fen>Option_1</fen> is the alternative they embraced first before pursuing <fen>Option_2</fen>.

When there is an explicitly separate construal of the <fen>Options</fen>, <fen>Option_2</fen> is the second-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a to-PP. When it is clear that  the <fen>Cognizer</fen> actually acted on their choice, <fen>Option_2</fen> is the alternative they embraced after abandoning <fen>Option_1</fen>.
This role denotes the <fen>Time</fen> interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps changing their mind about which of the <fen>Options</fen> to select.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps changing their mind between the <fen>Options</fen> that present themselves.
The <fen>Artist</fen> works off-stage to help make the <fen>Production</fen>.
The <fen>Production</fen> is the final product put out by the off-stage (and on-stage) participants.
An <fen>Artist</fen> may be categorizedy by <fen>Type</fen>.
Often (especially with film or television) the <fen>Production</fen> is advertised and transmitted to the audience by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.
This role indicates the particular orgainzaion that makes the <fen>Production</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Medium</fen> in which a particular <fen>Artist</fen> works or a <fen>Production</fen> is made.
In screen performances, the <fen>Performer</fen> is filmed as he or she acts out a role with respect to the larger <fen>Production</fen>
The music which may be performed in the performance of the <fen>Production</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.
A <fen>Scene</fen> is a sub-part of a larger production.  In film, scenes are sometimes recorded independently, and later edited into the final movie.
This role indicates the time when the <fen>Production</fen> is made.
This role indicates the location of production.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
listRoleExamples: Lee sold a textbook <fex>to Abby</fex>.
Kim sold <fex>the sweater</fex>.
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has sold more than three million copies.
<fex>The night lights</fex> were turned on in the secondary school.
Instantly <fex>Sue</fex> activated the commlink on the wall.
He was in his stocking feet while standing in the bayou that formed when <fex>the wind</fex> turned the shower on in that one upstairs bathroom.
My dad turned the lights on for me <fex>at 10 o'clock</fex>
Suddenly, the lights got turned on <fex>on the Jamaica road bridge</fex>.
The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
separate the yolks <fex>from the whites</fex>.
<fex>The researcher</fex> divided subjects into groups.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
<fex>I</fex> went back and forth over whether to post it or not, but the fact is that this blog is as much for you as it is for me.
In the late 1890s Carnegie vacillated <fex>between wanting to dominate the steel industry and wanting to sell out</fex>.
Editors go back and forth on a daily basis <fex>about what gets in the paper</fex>.
You've waffled <fex>from one explanation</fex> to another.
The heroine waffled from one plan <fex>to another</fex> and all of them were way out in 'left field'.

Here, however, the Romeros had provided some assurance to Ryan's mother of care,
although the court <fex>later</fex> waffled upon how much supervision was guaranteed
Do they know better than us that our dithering <fex>at the UN</fex> gave Saddam time to hide, destroy, and shuffle his weapons programs?
<fex>John Williams</fex> composed the soundtrack to Star Wars.
Ralph Smith produced <fex>the off-Broadway hit 'Why Is My Name Ralph?'</fex>.
<fex>Hollywood</fex> director
Even desperate producers would never produce a film <fex>for that television station</fex>.
The latest performance produced <fex>by The Umbrella Thesbians</fex> was a major hit in France.
He produces <fex>for television</fex>
This particular scene was shot <fex>with a local choir and dancers</fex>.
Silence of the Lambs was filmed <fex>in 1991</fex>.
The documentary was shot <fex>on location</fex>.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
